p: The effective function of cDCs in priming the T cell-mediated immune response depends on (1) trafficking of IAV-activated DCs into DLNs, (2) presentation of antigen to specific CD8 + T cells, and (3) lung homing capacity of activated CD8 + T cells. Migration of pulmonary cDCs into DLNs depends on expression of CCR7, as ccr7-deficient mice lack DC trafficking into DLNs [ 133, 135]. Both CD103 + cDCs and CD11b + cDCs express CCR7 [ 131] confirming the migratory nature of these cDCs. Once in the DLNs, these DCs prime IAV antigen-specific CD8 + T cells, which migrate into infected lungs in a CCR4-dependent manner [ 136] to exert anti-influenza activity ( Figure 2).
